tags.string: {string=} namespace - Namespace to query entities from.
tags.name: namespace

tags.html:
var dataset = gcloud.datastore.dataset({
projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123'
});

// If your dataset was scoped to a namespace at initialization, your query
// will likewise be scoped to that namespace.
var query = dataset.createQuery('Lion');

// However, you may override the namespace per query.
var query = dataset.createQuery('AnimalNamespace', 'Lion');

// You may also remove the namespace altogether.
var query = dataset.createQuery(null, 'Lion');

description.full:
Build a Query object.

Queries should be built with
{@linkcode module:datastore/dataset#createQuery} and run via
{@linkcode module:datastore/dataset#runQuery}.

More information on queries.
description.body:
Queries should be built with
{@linkcode module:datastore/dataset#createQuery} and run via
{@linkcode module:datastore/dataset#runQuery}.

More information on queries.

tags.string: {*} value - Value to compare property to.
tags.name: value

tags.html:
// List all companies named Google that have less than 400 employees.
var companyQuery = query
.filter('name =', 'Google')
.filter('size <', 400);

// To filter by key, use __key__ for the property name. Filter on keys
// stored as properties is not currently supported.
var keyQuery = query.filter('key =', dataset.key(['Company', 'Google']));

description.full:
Datastore allows querying on properties. Supported comparison operators
are =, <, >, <=, and >=. "Not equal" and IN operators are
currently not supported.

To filter by ancestors, see {@linkcode module:datastore/query#hasAncestor}.

More information on filtering by properties.
description.summary:
Datastore allows querying on properties. Supported comparison operators
are =, <, >, <=, and >=. "Not equal" and IN operators are
currently not supported.
description.body:
To filter by ancestors, see {@linkcode module:datastore/query#hasAncestor}.

More information on filtering by properties.

tags.string: {Key} key - Key object to filter by.
tags.name: key

description.full:
Filter a query by ancestors.

More information on filtering by ancestors.
description.body: More information on filtering by ancestors.

tags.string: {string} property - Optional operator (+, -) and property to order by.
tags.name: property
tags.description: • Optional operator (+, -) and property to order by.

tags.html:
// Sort by size ascendingly.
var companiesAscending = companyQuery.order('size');

// Sort by size descendingly.
var companiesDescending = companyQuery.order('-size');

description.full:
Sort the results by a property name in ascending or descending order. By
default, an ascending sort order will be used.

More information on sort orders.
description.summary:
Sort the results by a property name in ascending or descending order. By
default, an ascending sort order will be used.

description.full: Group query results by a list of properties.
description.summary: Group query results by a list of properties.

tags.string:
{string|string[]} fieldNames - Properties to return from the matched
    entities.
tags.name: fieldNames
tags.description: • Properties to return from the matched entities.

tags.html:
// Only retrieve the name property.
var selectQuery = companyQuery.select('name');

// Only retrieve the name and size properties.
var selectQuery = companyQuery.select(['name', 'size']);

description.full:
Retrieve only select properties from the matched entities.

Queries that select a subset of properties are called Projection Queries.

More information on projection queries.
description.summary: Retrieve only select properties from the matched entities.
description.body:
Queries that select a subset of properties are called Projection Queries.

More information on projection queries.

tags.html:
var cursorToken = 'X';

// Retrieve results starting from cursorToken.
var startQuery = companyQuery.start(cursorToken);

description.full:
Set a starting cursor to a query.

More information on query cursors.
description.summary: Set a starting cursor to a query.

tags.html:
var cursorToken = 'X';

// Retrieve results limited to the extent of cursorToken.
var endQuery = companyQuery.end(cursorToken);

description.full:
Set an ending cursor to a query.

More information on query cursors.
description.summary: Set an ending cursor to a query.

tags.string: {number} n - The number of results to limit the query to.
tags.name: n
tags.description: • The number of results to limit the query to.

tags.string:
// Limit the results to 10 entities.
var limitQuery = companyQuery.limit(10);
tags.html:
// Limit the results to 10 entities.
var limitQuery = companyQuery.limit(10);

description.full:
Set a limit on a query.

More information on query limits.

tags.string: {number} n - The offset to start from after the start cursor.
tags.name: n
tags.description: • The offset to start from after the start cursor.

tags.string:
// Start from the 101st result.
var offsetQuery = companyQuery.offset(100);
tags.html:
// Start from the 101st result.
var offsetQuery = companyQuery.offset(100);

description.full:
Set an offset on a query.

More information on query offsets.
